page.title: 07Fire Station Fireworks
page.content: In early November, close to Guy Fawkes Night on the 5th, the firemen at the fire station in Wombourne arrange a big bonfire and fireworks display. We used to have our own bonfire at the side of our house but my dad won't let us have it anymore. Last year some sparks went into his garden shed and a lot of it was burned. The fire engine had to come and the firemen put it out with water from their hoses. We will go to see the fireworks and the bonfire at the fire station this year. They have whistling rockets,roman candles, catherine wheels, fountains and lots of other noisy and colourful ones. The spectators are not allowed to go too near the bonfire. It is much safer than ours was but I can't throw anything on the fire now!
